intro: Sebastiania lesteri var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-sepal sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with smooth, glossy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure and attractive foliage make it a notable species in botanical collections.
